documents.title: microsoft surges
text: facebook fell a further 2.6 % on monday after the us federal trade commission said it will investigate the company over how private data on millions of users was given to cambridge analytica .

it was a different story for microsoft , however , which surged 7.5 % after morgan stanley raised its price target and said the firm could be worth $ 1 trillion on improved margins and growth in cloud computing .
intel rose 5.6 % after brokerage raymond james upgraded the stock .

documents.title: breakingwall street soars
text: the three main us stock market indices surged on monday to post their biggest daily percentage gain since august 2015 amid bargain-hunting and hopes that the us and china could negotiate new terms of trade and avoid a trade war .
the dow jones industrial average jumped 2.9 % , the s & p 500 rose 2.7 % and the nasdaq composite added 3.3 % .

documents.title: cannes bans netflix films from winning awards
text: the cannes film festival has decided that netflix and other streaming services are allowed to show their films , but they can not be in the running for a palme d'or .
cannes film festival 's chief thierry fremaux told hollywood reporter that since netflix continues to refuse to release its films in cinemas , it is barred from winning awards .

the french film industry considers streaming services to be a threat to the traditional cinema industry , and although amazon and netflix are providing funding to help directors make more big budget films , they have also changed the film industry irrevocably .
the netflix people loved the red carpet and would like to be present with other films .
but they understand that the intransigence of their own model is now the opposite of ours , '' said mr fremaux .
cinema [ still ] triumphs everywhere even in this golden age of series .
the history of cinema and the history of the internet are two different things . ''

documents.title: dpd improves workers rights after driver 's death
text: delivery firm dpd , under scrutiny after work pressures were blamed for the death of one of its drivers , is offering its 9,000 drivers holiday and sick pay as part of a new contract .
dpd , which delivers for john lewis and marks and spencer , says it is the first parcel carrier to offer such contracts .
in january , dpd driver don lane died after failing to attend hospital appointments for his diabetes .
his widow said he had become terrified of taking time off .
dpd denies this .

documents.title: twitter to ban crypto-currency ads
text: twitter is to start banning crypto-currency adverts from tuesday , following in the wake of google and facebook .
the new policy will prohibit the advertising of initial coin offerings ( ico ) - crowdfunding used to raise cash by creating new coins - as well as token sales .

crypto-currency exchanges and digital wallet services will also be prevented from advertising , unless they are public companies listed on certain major stock markets , or exchanges regulated by national financial regulators , as in japan .
bitcoin has lost more than half its value since it peaked at almost $ 20,000 in december , as fears of a regulatory clampdown spooked investors .
news of the facebook and google bans also knocked the price .

documents.title: would you give up a well-paid job for a short contract ?
text: would you give up a well-paid job for a six-month contract at living wage , with only the promise of help and mentoring to begin your own start-up with a social mission ?
that 's what 55 people from 19 countries have done , and by the end of this month they 'll know whether their gamble is likely to pay off .
they 're all part of the zinc programme , a business incubator which brings talented people together in london to try and solve a big social problem .
for the last six months they 've focused on creating companies which help improve the mental health of women and girls in developed countries .

documents.title: rbs investors want to see doj fine sorted
text: the royal bank of scotland ( rbs ) is currently waiting for the us department of justice ( doj ) to issue a fine relating to the mis-selling of retail mortgage-backed securities .

investors want to see this fine settled before they are willing to back the potential privatisation of rbs , according to james leigh-pemberton , the head of uk financial investments ( ukfi ) , which is overseeing the process .
`` it would be very helpful to have out of the way to enable a future sale , but it 's not the necessary condition for future sales , '' said mr leigh-pemberton .
`` in the current environment , there are investors who i think would like to see that matter resolved before committing themselves to rbs equity . ''

documents.title: big apple bonuses on the up
text: here 's something to cheer you right up : the average wall street bonus rose 17 % to $ 184,220 last year , according to a report released on monday by new york state 's chief fiscal officer .
the securities industry averaged 176,900 jobs in new york city last year , down slightly after three straight years of increases .
wall street banks paid $ 31.4bn in bonuses to employees during the traditional december-march bonus season .
employment in the industry , a key component of new york 's economy , remains 6 % smaller than before the financial crisis in 2007 .

documents.title: an invitation he ca n't refuse ?
text: the us senate judiciary committee has invited the chief executives of facebook ( as well as alphabet and twitter ) to testify at a 10 april hearing on data privacy .

senator charles grassley , the committee 's chairman , said he invited mark zuckerberg `` to testify at the hearing to discuss facebook 's past and future policies regarding the protection and monitoring of consumer data '' .
a facebook spokesman said the company had received the invitation and was reviewing it .

documents.title: saudi aramco says ipo still in the works
text: the chief executive of saudi aramco says an initial public offering of the giant oil company is still going to happen , despite skepticism from investors .
`` there 's a lot of work that is still ongoing , the ipo is ongoing , '' amin nasser told bloomberg .
he said that the company will be ready for a listing in the second-half of this year , but the saudi government would need to give final approval .
`` the venue and the timing is the government , '' he said .
do n't forget this is a very complex process .
aramco 's size and complexities is something that requires time . ''

documents.title: breakingselect in trouble with 2,000 jobs at stake
text: uk women 's and young adult fashion retailer select has asked corporate recovery and business advisory firm quantuma to advise it on a company voluntary arrangement .
select currently operates about 183 stores across britain and up to 2,000 jobs are at stake .
proposals for a cva were filed with the high court of justice today , and a creditors ' meeting on 13 april will decide on the company 's future .
the cva is trying to obtain approval from a number of landlords to accept a reduction in rent for some stores with an option to take back loss-making sites .

documents.title: ftse falls
text: the london market has ended the day on a low , and it 's not entirely clear why .
the ftse 100 closed down 0.5 % at 6,889 points .

while some blamed a sharply rise in the euro against the dollar , which weighs on european exporters , for a slide in continental markets , reuters adds that `` many are in the dark as to the sudden shift '' .
the biggest faller in london was smurfit kappa , while fresnillo topped the risers .
on the ftse 250 , ted baker fell close to 6 % , while petrofac posted the biggest gain .

documents.title: five countries collaborated on cyber-thief 's arrest
text: more details are emerging about europol 's operation to apprehend the leader of an international organised crime ring .
the carbanak gang stole £ 870m by targeting banks with malware campaigns .

`` the inclusion of police agencies in at least five different countries demonstrate how difficult it can be to track a single actor through all of their online activity and the jurisdictional challenges law enforcement faces while pursuing these criminals , '' said ross rustici , senior director of intelligence services at cybereason .
he added that police only caught the cyber-thief by `` following the money '' .
`` as long as you can not make major purchases with cryptocurrencies , the achilles heel of any organised crime activity will be laundering money and taxes , '' he said .
`` what remains to be seen is whether this arrest will result in a serious degradation of carbanak 's capabilities or merely a short-term hindrance while the group refocuses its activity . ''

documents.title: fcc proposes steps to protect us communication networks
text: ajit pai , chairman of the federal communications commission , has proposed new steps to prevent government funds from being used to purchase services or equipment from any company that poses a threat to us communication networks .

in particular , the fcc is concerned that routers , switches and most other types of telecommunications equipment can have `` back doors '' built into it that enables a foreign nation state to spy on the us .
us lawmakers are currently worried that technology sold by chinese smartphone maker huawei presents espionage threats .

documents.title: chrissy teigen drops snapchat
text: us model chrissy teigen may have caused contributed to a fall in snapchat 's shares after tweeting that she was dropping the app .
ms teigen tweeted on saturday : `` i stopped using snap .
the update , the constant complaints of people not being able to find me , plus the rihanna poll no bueno . ''
shares in snap are down 1.2 % at $ 16.15 in new york .

documents.title: facebook shares slide
text: shares in facebook are down more than 4 % to $ 152.60 .

documents.title: breakingftc confirms investigation into facebook
text: the federal trade commission has confirmed that is currently investigating facebook over privacy concerns .
the ftc is firmly and fully committed to using all of its tools to protect the privacy of consumers .

foremost among these tools is enforcement action against companies that fail to honor their privacy promises , including to comply with privacy shield , or that engage in unfair acts that cause substantial injury to consumers in violation of the ftc act , '' said tom pahl , acting director of the federal trade commission 's bureau of consumer protection .
`` companies who have settled previous ftc actions must also comply with ftc order provisions imposing privacy and data security requirements .
`` accordingly , the ftc takes very seriously recent press reports raising substantial concerns about the privacy practices of facebook .
today , the ftc is confirming that it has an open non-public investigation into these practices . ''

documents.title: first and second-class stamp prices rise
text: the 2p price rise in the cost of first and second class stamps has now taken effect .
a first-class stamp now costs 67p and a second-class stamp now costs 58p , under the price rises that came into force on monday .
stamps bought before the price rise can still be used without any need to top-up the cost .
royal mail said the squeeze on consumer finances was considered when setting the new price .

documents.title: gay wedding ban sparks cruise boycott call
text: carnival corporation , the cruise operator that owns p & o and cunard , is facing a boycott from lgbt travellers after halting gay weddings .
the company was forced to stop allowing same-sex unions because at least nine of its ships are registered in bermuda .
the british overseas territory legalised gay weddings in may last year , but the law was repealed last month following a change of government .

documents.title: cyber-crime chief arrested in spain
text: a cyber-crime mastermind suspected of stealing about £ 870m ( €1bn ) has been arrested in spain .
the individual is alleged to be the head of the organised crime gang that ran the carbanak and cobalt malware campaigns that targeted banks .
europol said the group had been active since 2013 and infiltrated more than 100 banks in that time .
cash was siphoned off via bank transfers or dispensed automatically through cash machines .

text: let 's have another look at markets .

but the ftse 250 has experienced a little more turmoil today , dipping below last friday 's close before recovering to edge up 0.07 % to 19,333,69 on the day so far .
the pound is holding onto gains against the dollar and is up 0.62 % at $ 1.42240 .
sterling is also trading 0.22 % higher on the euro at €1.14670 .

documents.title: lagarde calls for eurozone 'rainy day fund '
text: christine lagarde , managing director of the international monetary fund , said that eurozone leaders should set up a `` rainy day fund '' to help member states in the event of an economic downturn .

in a speech in berlin , ms lagarde said there is a `` sustained and broadly shared upswing '' in the global economy which she said offered leaders an opportunity `` complete the architecture '' of the eurozone .
but she said : `` there are other , forceful headwinds threatening .
think of the rise of populism and the short-sighted siren call of protectionism . ''
ms lagarde said the initial decision to get to work on building a rainy day fund could happen quickly .
`` within the next six months or so there could be a meeting of minds on the general principles and timeline , '' she said .
she said such an announcement `` let it be public that members of the currency union stick together '' .

documents.title: coutts banker accused of 'sexual harassment ' resigns
text: the coutts high-flyer embroiled in sexual harassment claims has resigned , according to a press report .
harry keogh had been accused of lewd comments , heavy drinking and unwanted physical contact .

a spokeswoman for royal bank of scotland , which owns coutts , told reuters : `` following recent media attention and the consequent strain placed on him and his family , harry keogh resigned last week . ''
mr keogh was in charge of managing relationships with some of coutts ' most influential clients .

documents.title: gategroup ditches flotation
text: gategroup , the swiss airline catering group , has ditched a plan to float the business in a deal that would have valued it at around $ 2.8bn .
chinese conglomerate hna group owns around 65 % in gategroup after investing in the company two years ago .
it blamed a `` a gap in valuation under current market conditions '' for not going ahead with the deal which was priced on 14 march .

documents.title: purplebricks warns on profits and sells stake to german publisher
text: axel springer has bought an 11.5 % of online estate agent purplebricks for £ 125m .
the german media company already has real estate brands in france - seloger - and germany - immowelt and immonet .

this minority stake offers the opportunity to participate in an innovative , fast-growing business model in new markets , '' said axel 's classifieds president andreas wiele , who will joing the purplebricks board .
meanwhile purplebricks warned that revenues for the year will be 5 % below expectations .
its share price has dropped around 8.5 % .

to date 9,073 workers have been found new roles .

documents.title: accountancy watchdog sets out strategy
text: the financial reporting council ( frc ) , the accountancy watchdog has just published its three-year strategy .
in it , it says that one of its priorities for the upcoming period is `` implementing a new approach to audit firm monitoring and supervision '' .

its chief executive stephen haddrill , says : `` our work to promote transparency and integrity in business means ensuring confidence in the way companies are governed , their financial reports and their audits is of utmost importance . ''
he adds : `` where we find failings we will act . ''

the timing could n't be better - last week business secretary greg clark suggested the government could launch an independent inquiry into the frc 's operations following the collapse of outsourcing and services group carillion .

documents.title: sterling up as markets eye rate rise
text: sterling rose by 0.6 % against the dollar to $ 1.42220 on expectations that the bank of england will lift the interest rate in may .
last week , the bank of england 's monetary policy committee ( mpc ) voted to hold the interest rate at 0.5 % .
however , two members of the nine-member committee - ian mccafferty and michael saunders - backed an increase to 0.75 % .
at the previous meeting , all nine members had voted to keep rates on hold .
on friday another committee member gertjan vlieghe indicted that the uk could expect to see `` one or two '' interest rate rises a year up until march 2021 .
lee hardman , an fx strategist at mufg , says : `` the pound continues to trade on a firmer footing following on from last week 's favourable developments . ''

documents.title: remington files for bankruptcy
text: us gun maker remington outdoor has filed for bankruptcy in the wake of slumping sales .
the firm , founded more than 200 years ago , filed for bankruptcy protection to cut a deal with its creditors .
remington 's chief financial officer said the company 's sales dropped significantly in the year before its bankruptcy , court papers show .

documents.title: speedy hire upbeat despite carillion collapse
text: shares in tools and equipment company speedy hire have jumped almost 9 % after it said it was expecting higher earnings .
that 's despite the recent collapse of major client carillion .
the firm said it has reduced its fleet and seen its recent acquisitions perform in line with expectations .
`` despite the recent liquidation of carillion , full-year revenues before disposals are expected to be approximately 6 % ahead of the prior year , '' the company said in a trading update .

documents.title: analysis : tough battle ahead of uber
text: uber is keen to push the message that this is n't a retreat from south east asia - that instead , this is a merger of equals - a partnership of sorts .
but while it 's true that uber does get a sizeable stake in grab , it is hard to ignore that this is the third market it is pulling out of .
first china , then russia - now south east asia .

look closely at the internal email that uber chief executive dara khosrowshahi sent his staff announcing the deal , and you can see a hint of an acknowledgement that perhaps their global strategy of barging into overseas markets is n't going as well as uber had planned .
`` one of the potential dangers of our global strategy , '' he writes , `` is that we take on too many battles across too many fronts with too many competitors . ''

this deal does beg the question what does uber do next in asia - because it is only really japan , south korea and india that it now operates in - and in all of those markets , it is facing competition of some sort , home grown or otherwise .
if this defeat at grab 's hands is anything to go by - uber best be prepared for a tough battle ahead .
author: Karishma Vaswani
Asia business correspondent

have you found something sus about about apple 's practices/terms of services ?
icloud stores your contacts purely as a form of backup so that if you lose your phone they can be restored .
apple is n't a data-mining company .
this was a very poor comparison from rory which will needlessly worry icloud users & risk them turning off services on which they rely .
i actually made the point because people came and made it to me - but then i stress that unlike apple facebook 's biz model depends on data
i understand .

and to be fair i know you 're normally on-point with this stuff , but the paragraph reads to non-technical iphone users as though there 's something to worry about , when actually they 're one of the few co 's ( subjectively ) who can be trusted , unlike fb , google et al .
obviously we should n't take for granted that apple does the right thing within grey areas .
but i agree less proficient people might misinterpret the comparison , and if their awareness of companies holding their data is the point i feel google ( and amazon ? )
should be mentioned too
this is what annoys me , i 'm not even on the bloody thing and it probably has personal contact details
i 've never given it my details , but about once a month i get a prompt to provide it my mobile number .
it is done with the guise of 'security ' .
does this mean that the us government can subpoena facebook to supply all this information if they want it ? ?
this article feels like it 's been sensationalised a little more than was necessary rory .
kudos for informing/reminding the public about app permissions but surely you were n't shocked , this is expected behaviour if you 've given fb permission to access your contacts .
i 'm wondering if perhaps all permissions should have an expiry on them .
just to remind us of what we 've given access to in the past .
only one good thing came out of me downloading my facebook data .
conversations with my mum i found , that i did n't remember having .
she died last year so it was at least nice to have a record of those .
otherwise it 's kind of disturbing the amount of stuff in there .
i never once gave facebook my phone number , they used to ask me regularly to add it to protect my account '' but i refused .
then they started to show me my actual number , asking me to confirm it !
they obtained it elsewhere and assigned it to my account without my permission .
what i missed in this article : the steps you took to unlink your contacts with your facebook
this has long been a serious issue long ignored by everyone .
facebook has created 3 shadow accounts for me , prepopulated with address , phones , birth date .
but to cavalierly toss in icloud without explaining its protocols or the differences is irresponsible .
oranges and apples .
i suspect facebook have to covertly collect phone data because their other data is of such poor quality .
some thoughts from before the scandal :
hahaha thats because you are listed in the 'dumb f ' group on facebooks tiering .
what do you think twitter has ?
i too was shocked to find this .
so how do we delete this data that facebook has on us ?
i do n't want my mobile number out there .
good article .
thanks
i followed your instructions rory but did n't get email link .
tried again this morning and it seems as though that option has been removed from facebook .
i downloaded my data and found all my personal contacts listed despite not having enabled the feature .
whats even scarier is the function is switched off on my phone yet a new contact i added at the weekend was included .
facebook not replied , apple just sent standard reply !

documents.title: credit card spending soars
text: credit card spending through high street banks climbed 6.3 % in the last 12 months , according to uk finance .
it was the highest growth figures since april 2017 as people turn to plastic instead of loans or overdrafts .
the use of the latter dropped by 4 % over the year .

we are seeing a continuing rise in credit card spending , reflecting the growing number of transactions carried out using cards , while other forms of borrowing such as overdrafts continue to fall , '' said eric leenders , managing director , personal finance at the industry body .

documents.title: predator edges ahead of its prey
text: russ mould , investment director at aj bell , suggest that the odds have swung back in favour of melrose in the fight for gkn .

he says : the way in which gkn 's shares have started to trade at a slowly decreasing discount to the price implied by melrose 's cash-and-stock offer suggests that the argument is starting to swing back in favour of the predator rather than the prey .
`` this is despite strong opposition to the bid from politicians and champions of british industry , as well as concerns from customers of the aerospace operations . ''

documents.title: mortgage lending up ahead possible rate rise
text: gross mortgage lending rose by 4.9 % to £ 19bn in february compared to the same month last year , according to uk finance , the trade association for uk banks and financial businesses .
however , it said the figure is below the monthly average of £ 21.4bn for 2017 .
remortgage approvals in february rose over 9 % both number and value compared to last year .

eric leenders , managing director , personal finance at uk finance said : there has been an increase in remortgage approvals compared to last year , as borrowers look to lock in to attractive deals amid speculation of further interest rate rises later this year . ''

documents.title: finish line 'fits the bill ' for jd sports
text: jonathan pritchard , retail analyst at peel hunt , reckons jd sports ' us deal is good business .
jd aspires to be a member of the global elite of sports retailers but it 's hard to do that without boots on the ground in the usa .
it would be almost impossible to build a major presence there organically .
so , an acquisition was always going to be the best way in .
finish line fits the bill nicely , at a sensible price for a material presence in the market via some assets that need a shot in the arm .

documents.title: tariff exemption lifts south korean stocks
text: south korea 's steel sector has boosted its benchmark kospi index which rose 0.8 % after the us agreed to exempt the country from import tariffs .
key firms posco gained 2 % , while dongbu steel jumped 6.9 % .
in japan , tokyo 's nikkei 225 index closed rose 0.7 % or 148.24 points at 20,766.10 .
hong kong 's heng seng is up 202.85 points at 30,512.14 .

documents.title: 'dire ' facebook breach demands regulation
text: some of the tech sector 's biggest companies believe there should be more oversight on how personal data is used following the facebook breach .
speaking at the china development forum in beijing , apple 's chief executive tim cook says : it 's clear to me that something , some large profound change is needed .

i 'm personally not a big fan of regulation because sometimes regulation can have unexpected consequences to it , however i think this certain situation is so dire , and has become so large , that probably some well-crafted regulation is necessary . ''
ibm 's chief executive ginni rometty ( says : `` if you 're going to use these technologies , you have to tell people you 're doing that , and they should never be surprised . ''

documents.title: jd sports shares climb on us deal
text: the stock market has given the thumbs up to jd sports ' acquisition of us athletic shoe chain finish line .
its shares have climbed 3.7 % to 369p this morning .
the company has spent almost £ 400m on the 556 branch american chain .

documents.title: shareholders hang back on gkn/melrose
text: investors in gkn seem to be holding fire on monday morning - the ftse 100 engineering group 's shares have barely budged at 428.9p .
it remains below melrose 's 462p per share offer for the company .
shares in melrose were also flat at 219p .
the wider ftse 100 is up 14.37 points at 6,936.31 .
shares in precious metals miner fresnillo are leading the risers , up 3.6 % at £ 12.52 .
smurfit kappa is the biggest faller , down 2.7 % at £ 29.74 , after it rejected a fresh takeover offer by international paper .
the ftse 250 is up 21.26 points at 19,340.74 .
the pound is up 0.33 % against the dollar at $ 1.41820 .

`` this is deeply disappointing and certainly not what anyone expects from our national cricket team , '' airline qantas , whose logo is on the team shirts in south africa , told afp in sydney .
`` we are in discussions with cricket australia as this issue unfolds . ''

documents.title: smurfit kappa shares drop on bid rejection
text: packaging company smurfit kappa said it has rejected a revised bid offer from international paper .
the fresh offer was made on thursday and would give shareholders 0.3028 new shares plus €25.25 cash for each share they hold .
but smurfit said the bid failed to reflect the company 's `` intrinsic value , track record and superior prospects as an independent business '' .
liam o'mahony , chairman of the packager , said : the revised proposal does not make strategic sense for smurfit kappa and its stakeholders . ''
the company 's shares dropped 4.4 % to £ 29.22 on the news .

documents.title: south korea wins us steel tariff exemption
text: the us has agreed to exempt south korea from president donald trump 's steel tariffs .
the new tariffs which came into effect last friday , impose a 25 % duty on steel and 10 % tax on aluminium .
the exemption was granted after the two sides reached in principle '' agreement on a trade deal known as korus .
as a result , south korea will become the first us ally to be let off from the hefty charges .
however , washington will still be able to limit south korea 's steel exports by imposing a quota of 2.68m tonnes .
that represents 70 % of south korea 's average annual steel exports to the us over the past three years .

australia is all about 'fair go ' , and i think all australians are very disappointed with what 's happened with the cricket team . ''

documents.title: power of the pineapple
text: is the avocado in danger of being thrown over by the pineapple as britain 's most popular fruit ?
apparently it has already happened according to the guardian .

morgan jaquemet , fresh pineapple buyer at tesco , told the newspaper : `` pineapples have become the fruit taste of the moment and could soon rival the avocado as a once niche fruit suddenly gaining mainstream popularity .
`` in the last few years we have seen demand jump because of the fruit 's rising popularity as a versatile and healthy food . ''

documents.title: brexit 'uncertainty ' for financial sector
text: the cbi has reported that that sentiment among banks and other institutions is at its lowest level since march 2009 .
rain newton-smith , the cbi 's chief economist tells the today programme that : `` uncertainty is looming large over brexit for the sector . ''

she added : `` but we did see a huge step forward last week with the transition agreement in place which means a lot of the banks and insurance companies will be able to put the pause button on their contingency plans . ''

documents.title: gkn welcomes improved dana offer
text: commenting on dana 's imrproved offer , gkn 's chairman mike turner , says : `` we are confident that , following the dana transaction and the non-core disposals , gkn will become a pure play aerospace company with a strong balance sheet , our pension challenges behind us and a clear plan for delivering leading margin performance .
`` we therefore expect the market to fully value this highly attractive business in line with its peers . ''

documents.title: dana increases cash portion of gkn deal
text: meanwhile , dana , the us company that wants to buy gkn 's american automotive business , has improved its offer for the division .
dana has increased the cash portion of the $ 6bn deal by $ 140m to $ 1.77bn .

jonathan collins , executive vice president and chief financial officer of dana , said : `` today 's announcement demonstrates our support for investors following a series of productive meetings where the many benefits of the combination have become ever more apparent . ''

documents.title: jd sports enters us through shoe shop deal
text: jd sports has splashed out $ 558m ( £ 396m ) on us footwear chain the finish line .
the us company has 556 stores and sells athletic shoes in 375 branded and 188 unbranded concessions in macy 's stores .
it employs 3,700 full-time and 9,300 part-time staff .

`` finish line has many similarities to jd with a strong bricks and mortar offering complemented by an advanced and well-invested digital platform , '' said peter cowgill , jd sports ' executive chairman .
he said : this is a landmark day for jd and will be transformational for the business . ''

documents.title: breakinggkn retracts supportive investors statements
text: another day , another extraordinary development in melrose 's £ 7.9bn hostile bid for gkn .
in a stock exchange announcement , it says : `` gkn notes the articles published by the sunday telegraph and sunday times on 25 march 2018 relating to gkn and melrose industries plc .
`` the sunday telegraph article contained a comment by anne stevens , chief executive , that `` stevens says she 's convinced investors will back [ gkn ] .

`` the sunday times article contained a comment by jos sclater , group finance director , that `` long-only shareholders are mostly supportive of existing management , and understand that the dana deal and becoming a pure play aerospace company has , longer term , significantly more value than the melrose bid '' .
`` gkn confirms that these statements of shareholder support in respect of gkn were not verified and are hereby retracted . ''

documents.title: gkn : 'only itself to blame '
text: russ mould , a j bell 's investment director tells the bbc 's today programme that the fate of gkn , a founder member of the ftse 100 , needs `` to be decided very carefully '' .

he says that if the company had n't doled out a big profits warning last autumn about problems with its us accounts and the chief executive succession , it might not have found itself in this position in the first place .
`` it 's only got itself to blame if it does lose its independence because its operational and financial performance over time really has n't been that good , '' he says .

documents.title: a sale by any other name
text: uber 's chief executive dara khosrowshahi says that its deal with grab regarding the ride-sharing company 's south east asia business is a merger not a sale .
uber will retain a 27.5 % stake in the enlarged group .
in an email to uber staff , mr khosrowshahi explains the rationale behind the agreement .
he says : `` one of the potential dangers of our global strategy is that we take on too many battles across too many fronts and with too many competitors . ''
he adds : `` while m & a will always be an important value-creation tool for our company , going forward we will be focused on organic growth

documents.title: trump 's china import tariffs just 'opening salvo '
text: last week , us president donald trump proposed china import tariffs worth over $ 50bn and investment restrictions on chinese companies .
is there be some sound rationale behind america 's move ?

rod hunter , partner at law firm baker mckenzie in washington and a former white house senior economics director , tells the bbc 's today programme that mr trump 's aim could be `` to shorten supply chains and bring manufacturing back to the us , or to leverage negotiations to produce a more level playing field for american manufacturers . ''
he points out that the measures affect just a small part of the chinese economy but warns that `` the fears that many have about a trade war are quite real '' .
he adds : `` however this is just the opening salvo in a series of negotiations with the chinese and other trading partners . ''
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: 'last chance saloon ' for gender pay reporting
text: public and private employers are facing a `` last chance saloon '' on publishing data on their respective gender pay gaps on time .
if not , they could face `` unlimited fines '' according to the equality and human rights commission .
all companies with more than 250 staff must publish the difference between the median hourly pay of men and that of women at their firm by 4 april .
public sector bodies face an earlier deadline of 30 march .

documents.title: tough trading for the ftse
text: the ftse 100 blue chip index is now back to where it was in december 1999 .
russ mould , investment director at aj bell says this is down to a number of reasons .
firstly , the pound is rising which means that because two third of the companies in the ftse 100 generate their profits overseas , their income is worth less .
secondly major banks who are listed on the ftse 100 have not been performing while thirdly `` the uk is as worried as everybody else is about this trade and tariff situation '' .
he adds : `` the other complication is the us federal reserve is raising interest rates .
even the bank of england is talking a tougher game than it has for a very long time .
over a period of time with higher interest rates , better returns on cash will suck money away from riskier assets like shares . ''

documents.title: chickens coming home to roost for gkn ?
text: russ mould , investment director aj bell , highlights a story in the sunday times which said that around a quarter of gkn 's shares are owned by either hedge funds or so-called merger arbitrage funds who exploit minor price differences between the current gkn share price and the offer from melrose .
this means that they could very well decide the fate of gkn on thursday .
gkn 's chief executive anne stevens eloquently opined that these types of investors do n't give `` a crap '' about the long-term future of the company .

but mr mould says : `` elliott advisors , which is admittedly one of those rather aggressive hedge funds , is saying 'look , if gkn hadbeen run properly , had done a better job , it would n't find itself in this mess in the first place ' and i have some sympathy with that .
`` do n't forget , just six months ago gkn doled out a really big profit warning because it found accounting problems in the us .

`` the putative chief executive who was going to get the job did n't get the job and just sort of disappeared so it has n't been a company that has really performed for a long time so you can understand why some shareholders might not be as supportive of it as they might have been otherwise . ''
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: uber sells south east asia business
text: uber is selling its south east asia ride-share and food delivery businesses to regional rival grab .
the move marks a further retreat from international operations for uber , after it sold its china business to local rival didi chuxing in 2016 .
the sale is part of chief executive dara khosrowshahi 's long-term plan to ensure that uber makes a profit by 2019 so he can then float the business .
